result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryant M Harmon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge; pay court costs and victim/witness surcharges. To be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 7/18/2020; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment. Restitution set at zero

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryant M Harmon

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING transcript (29 pages) commencing JULY 18, 2014 received and filed. kl

Defendant Bryant M Harmon in court with attorney Megan Barbara.  Defendant Bryant M Harmon in custody.  Karyn E. Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. Additional statements by: Valencia C.
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 0 days.
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 7/18/2020; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 7/18/2020; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Employment or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Bryant M Harmon in court with attorney Megan Barbara.  Defendant Bryant M Harmon in custody.  Karyn E Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
AS TO COUNT 1:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.
AS TO COUNT 2:
  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered Count 2 DISMISSED and READ IN.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Case calendared for SENTENCING on 7/18/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Attorney Megan Barbara in court, defendant Bryant M Harmon not in court, in custody.  Karyn E. Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for FINAL PRETRIAL on 5/23/2014 at 8:30 am and JURY TRIAL on 6/16/2014 at 9:00 am in Branch 15. Pretrial Scheduling Order signed and filed.

Defendant Bryant M Harmon in court with attorney Matt Last for Megan Barbara.  Defendant Bryant M Harmon in custody.  Karyn E. Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Scott Lackovic-MPD Detective. Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #10CF4821 that are attached to the complaint.     State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with FM (7/9/2000) AND KS (10/5/1998).
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Bryant M Harmon in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Bryant M Harmon in custody.  Lucy J. Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant pled not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNT 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WATTS, Branch 15.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
